content.description: Climb the same start as Encore, via the bolted crack. After the initial steepness, move right on lower angle and easier terrain until the upper headwall. Steep climbing on good holds with a short crux takes you to the top.
Start on Minions. After 3rd bolt head up and right to a brown calcite -covered wall left of "Encore" arete. Fun techie climbing!
content.protection: Bolts, 2 long runners would be nice!
content.location: Left of Encore or second route in the cinema on the left side.

climbs.name: Saving Ryan’s Privates
climbs.fa: Paul Davis, A. Hammer and A. Brush

content.description: Short route with fun, vertical movement.  Pockets, side pulls, arete pinching and blind foot match in a hueco, what’s not to like?  This packs a good outing in 35 feet.
content.protection: 5 glue-in protection bolts, 2 glue-in anchor bolts and lowering hooks.
content.location:
Now the first route you encounter as walk over to the Cinema after passing the Theater.  Glue-in bolts and Climb-Tech hooks at the anchor are clues.

This pitch faces the river and is about 30’ left of Minions.

content.description: Good addition to the Cinema playbill.  Laybacks, pockets, slabbing and some techy footwork fill up the 60 feet of this enjoyable pitch.
content.location: Starts just left of Footloose on a couple of stacked blocks.

content.description: Short well bolted route.  Shares the first bolt with Adventures in Babysitting then branches right.

Starts right of Ryan’s Privates and left of the Encore start, 2 glue in bolts are visible.  Climb a pseudo-huecod crack feature to a stance 25 feet up.  Continue upward on a lower angled slab feature with fun movement.
content.location: This is the second route you encounter at the Cinema.  It’s between Saving Ryan’s Privates and just left of the Encore start.

climbs.name: Men in Tights
climbs.fa: BJ Sbarra, Lynn Sanson, Josh Gross

content.description: Crux in the middle, around fourth bolt where hand holds become slim and a slightly dynamic move is needed to reach next hand holds.
content.location: In the middle of the right side of the Cinema

content.description: Shares the same start as Babel, atop the mega large cheat stone pile. Climb up the steep corner crack and at the second or third bolt move right across the easy slab to the steep left facing corner. Climb the steep corner and finish on easier terrain above.
content.location: Shares same start as Babel, atop the mega large cheat stone pile but moves right. The rightmost route on this section of wall.

climbs.name: FootLoose
climbs.fa: BJ Sbarra, Lynn Sanson, Josh Gross

content.description: Difficult start with only friction for feet followed by a wandering lead.
content.location: Leftmost bolted route on the right side of the Cinema

content.description: Climb through steep terrain at the start, next to a crack. The angle quickly eases and super mellow slab climbing leads to the obvious arete. The steep arete is what you really came to climb on this route. Enjoy its solid rock, fun movement and great positioning to the anchor.
content.location: There are two bolted starts on the more west-facing wall of the Cinema. Encore starts on the left bolted start.

content.description: The crux is right at the start on this one as you climb the corner through the weakness in the low, steep roof at the bottom of the cliff. A large pile of rocks serves as a much-appreciated "cheater" stone to get you off the ground. After pulling the moves at the start, climb the easy, low-angled face to the steeper headwall with a finger-sized crack. Finger-sized gear may be desired through this section.
content.protection: 10? bolts with optional finger-sized gear to 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Starts to the right of Encore where a low but steep roof is climbed through a corner. There is a large pile of rocks that serves as the largest "cheater" stone you may ever see but it's much appreciated.

content.description: First Bolt is Shared with One Eyed Willy then branch left.  The fourth bolt can be tricky, you can skip it or go right of it and traverse to clip it.
